column2: Proband is asked (1) to walk at a safe distance parallel to a wall including a half-turn (turn around to face the opposite direction of gait) and (2) to walk in tandem (heels to toes) without support. Score _______-
column17: 0 = Normal, no difficulties in walking, turning and walking tandem (up to one misstep allowed)
column18: 1 = Slight difficulties, only visible when walking 10 consecutive steps in tandem
column19: 2 = Clearly abnormal, tandem walking >10 steps not possible
column20: 3 = Considerable staggering, difficulties in half-turn, but without support
column21: 4 = Marked staggering, intermittent support of the wall required
column22: 5 = Severe staggering, permanent support of one stick or light support by one arm required
column23: 6 = Walking > 10 m only with strong support (two special sticks or stroller or accompanying person)
column24: 7 = Walking < 10 m only with strong support (two special sticks or stroller or accompanying person)

column2: Proband is asked to stand (1) in natural position, (2) with feet together in parallel (big toes touching each other) and (3) in tandem (both feet on one line, no space between  heel and toe). Proband does not wear shoes, eyes are open. For each condition, three trials are allowed. Best trial is rated. Score __________
column17: 0 = Normal, able to stand in tandem for > 10 s
column18: 1 = Able to stand with feet together without sway, but not in tandem for > 10s
column19: 2 = Able to stand with feet together for > 10 s, but only with sway
column20: 3 = Able to stand for > 10 s without support in natural position but not with feet together
column21: 4 = Able to stand for >10 s in natural position only with intermittent support
column22: 5 = Able to stand >10 s in natural position only with constant support of one arm
column23: 6 = Unable to stand for >10 s even with constant support of one arm

column2: Proband is asked to sit on an examination bed without support of feet, eyes open and arms outstretched to the front. Score _____________
column19: 2 = Constant sway, but able to sit > 10 s without support
column20: 3 = Able to sit for > 10 s only with intermittent support
column21: 4 = Unable to sit for >10 s without continuous support

column2: Speech is assessed during normal conversation.
column19: 2 = Impaired speech, but easy to understand

column2: Rated separately for each side  Proband sits comfortably. If necessary, support of feet and trunk is allowed. Examiner sits in front of proband and performs 5 consecutive sudden and fast pointing  movements in unpredictable directions in a frontal plane, at about 50 % of proband´s reach. Movements have an amplitude of 30 cm and a frequency of 1 movement  every 2 s. Proband is asked to follow the movements with his index finger, as fast and precisely as possible. Average performance of last 3 movements is rated.  Score Right ___________

Rated separately for each side  Proband sits comfortably. If necessary, support of feet and trunk is allowed. Examiner sits in front of proband and performs 5 consecutive sudden and fast pointing  movements in unpredictable directions in a frontal plane, at about 50 % of proband´s reach. Movements have an amplitude of 30 cm and a frequency of 1 movement  every 2 s. Proband is asked to follow the movements with his index finger, as fast and precisely as possible. Average performance of last 3 movements is rated.  Score Left: ____________

Rated separately for each side  Proband sits comfortably. If necessary, support of feet and trunk is allowed. Proband is asked to point repeatedly with his index finger from his nose to examiner’s finger which is in front of the proband at about 90 % of proband’s reach. Movements are performed at moderate speed. Average performance of movements is rated according to the amplitude of the kinetic tremor. Score Right: ______________

Rated separately for each side  Proband sits comfortably. If necessary, support of feet and trunk is allowed. Proband is asked to point repeatedly with his index finger from his nose to examiner’s finger which is in front of the proband at about 90 % of proband’s reach. Movements are performed at moderate speed. Average performance of movements is rated according to the amplitude of the kinetic tremor.  Score Left: _______________

Rated separately for each side  roband sits comfortably. If necessary, support of feet and trunk is allowed. Proband is asked to perform 10 cycles of repetitive alternation of pro- and supinations of  possible. Movement is demonstrated by examiner at a speed of approx. 10 cycles within 7 s. Exact times for movement execution have to be taken.  Score Right: ___________
column19: 2 = Clearly irregular, single movements difficult to distinguish or relevant interruptions, but performs <10s
column20: 3 = Very irregular, single movements difficult to distinguish or relevant interruptions, performs >10s

column2: Rated separately for each side  roband sits comfortably. If necessary, support of feet and trunk is allowed. Proband is asked to perform 10 cycles of repetitive alternation of pro- and supinations of  possible. Movement is demonstrated by examiner at a speed of approx. 10 cycles within 7 s. Exact times for movement execution have to be taken.  Score Left: ___________
column19: 2 = Clearly irregular, single movements difficult to distinguish or relevant interruptions, but performs <10s
column20: 3 = Very irregular, single movements difficult to distinguish or relevant interruptions, performs >10s

column19: 2 = Clearly irregular, single movements difficult to distinguish or relevant interruptions, but performs <10s
column20: 3 = Very irregular, single movements difficult to distinguish or relevant interruptions, performs >10s

column2: Rated separately for each side  roband lies on examination bed, without sight of his legs. Proband is asked to lift one leg, point with the heel to the opposite knee, slide down along the shin to the ankle, and lay the leg back on the examination bed. The task is performed 3 times. Slide-down movements should be performed within 1 s. If proband slides down without contact to shin in all three trials, rate 4.  Score Right:_____________
column18: 1 = Slightly abnormal, contact to shin maintained
column19: 2 = Clearly abnormal, goes off shin up to 3 times during 3 cycles
column20: 3 = Severely abnormal, goes off shin 4 or more times during 3 cycles

column2: Rated separately for each side  roband lies on examination bed, without sight of his legs. Proband is asked to lift one leg, point with the heel to the opposite knee, slide down along the shin to the ankle, and lay the leg back on the examination bed. The task is performed 3 times. Slide-down movements should be performed within 1 s. If proband slides down without contact to shin in all three trials, rate 4.  Score Left:_____________
column18: 2 = Slightly abnormal, contact to shin maintained
column19: 3 = Clearly abnormal, goes off shin up to 3 times during 3 cycles
column20: 4 = Severely abnormal, goes off shin 4 or more times during 3 cycles

column18: 3 = Slightly abnormal, contact to shin maintained
column19: 4 = Clearly abnormal, goes off shin up to 3 times during 3 cycles
column20: 5 = Severely abnormal, goes off shin 4 or more times during 3 cycles

column2: Mean values from each one of the eight items are summed to obtain the total score.  The total scores range from 0 (no ataxia) to 40 (severe ataxia).
